# packages/adapter-rust/vendor/codelldb/darwin-x64/lldb/lib/python3.12/site-packages/pip/_internal/models/candidate.py
@source-hash: cf380546ec3f9163
@generated: 2026-02-09T17:59:23Z

## Purpose
Data model for representing a Python package installation candidate within pip's internal package resolution system.

## Core Classes

**InstallationCandidate (L10-25)**
- Frozen dataclass representing a potential package for installation
- Immutable container for package metadata: name, version, and download link
- Custom `__init__` required due to frozen dataclass constraints with `__slots__`

## Key Attributes
- `name` (str): Package name identifier
- `version` (Version): Parsed semantic version using packaging library
- `link` (Link): Download source location and metadata

## Dependencies
- `pip._vendor.packaging.version`: Version parsing and comparison utilities (L3-4)
- `pip._internal.models.link.Link`: Link model for package sources (L6)

## Implementation Details
- Uses `__slots__` for memory optimization (L13)
- Custom `__init__` (L19-22) bypasses frozen dataclass restrictions using `object.__setattr__`
- Version string automatically parsed to `Version` object during initialization (L21)
- String representation (L24-25) provides human-readable candidate summary

## Architectural Role
Central data structure in pip's dependency resolution pipeline, bridging package discovery and installation phases. Enables comparison and sorting of installation options.
